title: Verbal Abuse from Client chat
body:
So I'm not sure what the go is with reporting someone for verbal abuse that's on your friends' list. but after a particularly bad ranked game (by our whole team, not just me) one of the players on my team adds me as a friend.

I was well aware of what I was getting into after I declined his friend request four times before accepting it to let him say what he wanted and leave me alone.

He then proceeded to Flame our other teammates from that game and probably assumed I'd join in. He said he wanted to bash their heads in and after I told him that kind of behaviour wasn't on he decided to direct his anger towards me and generally be a disgusting person with more detailed threats about how he'd murder me as he went on and asking me if I was a male or female which I never answered because he was obviously looking for something to insult me about regardless of what I told him.

The thing that took me by surprise the most though was that as soon as he'd finished his rant and he unfriended me. The entire conversation was gone?
I couldn't screenshot it or copy paste it or anything. It just disappeared. 

My question is, is there a way to report people who are so persistent as to constantly friend request then threaten my life multiple times (which I'm pretty sure is **illegal **when done face to face)? and why is all the incriminating evidence removed from my access as soon as he unfriends me? It seems pretty ridiculous that they are allowed to get away with that sort of behaviour and not give and way to report it.

replies.body:
Just send a ticket to riot under reporting other players, state this players name, and then they can go through your logs with that player (or at least i hope they can, since once its on the net, it can't leave)

Otherwise, in future if this happens, instead of just letting it happen, screenshot/copy paste as it happens so even after the leave (even if you can't get a full transcript) you  have evidence of what transgressed

^ This. I am unsure if [support](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) have access to PM logs under the privacy policies, but I can only assume they would for scenarios just like this. And yes, threats (even on the internet) are illegal, and can be prosecuted by law enforcement.

While I 100% agree with you, I had something similar happen to me and when I submitted a ticket the response was basically that it was my fault for accepting the request and that they don't police private messages. /shrug

Unlucky you then

I've sent several tickets on this kind of topic, the only time i get that response is when they feel that i was the one who instigated it (I do this, i get a sick sense of joy out of triggering people), most of the time though, i get the typical 'we can't tell you that we banned them, but we are looking into it' response, but it seems to work, i've seen several of my reported/ticketed players stop playing for 14 days, so although riot's support team is useless, they must do something at some level

Maybe it was just the support member I got then. I submitted the ticket literally just saying I wanted to report someone for threats to me and my mother but since they weren't made in game or in the lobby, I was submitting online and then explained what happened. This was the reply I got. 

Hello,

I'm sorry to bring you these news, but we cannot police personal direct messages, and thus you are responsible for your own interactions with anyone. Keep in mind that you should contact your local authorities if you feel threatened due to your interactions with other players.

Please keep in mind that you should not ever keep anyone in your friends list if you don't want to chat with them. You always have the option of blocking other players, and I advise you to make use of it anytime you feel uncomfortable talking to them about anything.

I hope that you will understand the fact that continuing any bothersome conversation with someone in private messages is your own responsibility- again, as previously mentioned, you always have the blocking option available.

Please let us know if there's something else we could help you with.

Thank you! this is what I was looking for.

To be honest I didn't think about screenshotting the conversation until a few seconds before he unfriended me.
Hopefully, the ticket will sort things out.

Thanks again for the info.
Without evidence. Your words mean almost nothing.

Well that's the issue, isn't it. I mean it wouldn't be difficult to add him back and make him have another tantrum but that isn't really the point. 

Why is it that if that aggressor doesn't want their behaviour to be seen all they have to do is unfriend the victim and all evidence is removed from both parties. 

The question was why is it not possible to report people in the client but it is possible in-game for doing the exact same thing?

You know what this boil down to? 

When the other guy raged at you; You stand there with your mouth closed saying nothing. And when all is said and done; Thinking back on how shamefully you have being treated, your soul is now crying out for some sort of payback.

Next time, if you dont have the heart to fight, dont get in a fight in the 1st place.
